discussion.content:
D. Detailed information should be logged. Detailed information
on the errors typically includes debugging information. By logging
this information, it makes it easier for developers to identify what
caused the error and how to resolve it.

questions.question_text: Which of the following outcomes is a result of proper error-handling procedures in secure code?

choices.B: Minor fault conditions result in the system stopping to preserve state.
choices.A: Execution continues with no notice or logging of the error condition.
choices.D: All fault conditions are logged and do not result in a program crash.
choices.C: The program runs through to completion with no detectable impact or output.

discussion.content:
On a Switched Network = ARP Poisoning. 

On a Routed Network = IP Spoofing.

comments.content: Also, IP spoofing doesn't allow you to sniff a network. It just means you are changing your IP.

discussion.content:
Would have been sure if ARP Spoofing was listed.
ARP Spoofing: 
In this case, an attacker can spoof the MAC address of a trusted host and forge ARP request/replies to overload the Switch. Then the switch is set in “forward mode” an attacker can now sniff the packets on the traffic.

ARP Poisoning:
Attacker chooses targets and floods their ARP cache with forged entries thus replacing the MAC address of targets with MAC address of attacker. ARP poisoning is used in Man in the middle attack.

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ARP_spoofing
Sniffing in a Switched Network >>> ... It’s the path of arp spoofing. By using this technique you can fool your target machines to send data through your attacking machine and then you can sniff it on your attacking machine. ... (http://articles.manugarg.com/arp_spoofing.pdf)

questions.question_text: Which of the following enables sniffing attacks against a switched network?

discussion.content: Geofencing is the act of creating a virtual boundary around a geographic area.

questions.question_text: A company wants to ensure users are only logging into the system from their laptops when they are on site. Which of the following would assist with this?
During a penetration test, the tester performs a preliminary scan for any responsive hosts. Which of the following BEST explains why the tester is doing this?

choices.C: To identify servers for subsequent scans and further investigation
choices.B: To identify the total number of hosts and determine if the network can be victimized by a DoS attack
choices.A: To determine if the network routes are improperly forwarding request packets
choices.D: To identify the unresponsive hosts and determine if those could be used as zombies in a follow-up scan.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is being used when a malicious actor searches various social media websites to find information about a company's system administrators and help desk staff?

discussion.content: I'm guessing it's not Social Engineering because the threat actor is not directly interacting with the targets. Therefore A over D.

comments.content: No need to guess, that is what it is
